body.name: I'm the Evil Lord of an Intergalactic Empire! (Light Novel) Vol. 6
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Yomu Mishima is a Japanese writer best known for titles exploring the isekai genre, such as Trapped in a Dating Sim: The World of Otome Games is Tough for Mobs and I'm the Evil Lord of an Intergalactic Empire!Takamine Nadare is an illustrator best known for the light novel series I’m the Evil Lord of an Intergalactic Empire!
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 22 mins
body.description: A CLASH OF FLASH AND...FLASH?In his previous life, Liam played by the rules and lost—this time, he'll rise to the top on the side of evil! After protecting Prince Cleo from Prince Linus's assassination attempts, another prince's actions are leading to something much worse: the Empire being invaded! Liam is caught in this brewing conflict and racks up enemies inside and outside the Empire, but two individuals step up to the plate to challenge him personally...while claiming to be fellow disciples of the Way of the Flash! Can Liam cut through these conflicts and still take care of his domain?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The prologue ends and Liam enters Act 1 with a SLASH.
reviews.reviewText: This volume simultaneously ties up so many plot lines, and then sets up several more arcs using the same characters that seemed to have their stories wrapped up.Man it is hard to review this without going into spoilers for this LN, and 2 or 3 volumes after this.Let me just say, if you read the Web Novel and liked/loved it then you will be in for more depth of the characters you love, and if you have just read the LN the you also get that character depth but also closure of the first or second arcs of the plot of some characters and the plot overall.5 Star - This is where things leave the prologue/first act, and things start getting Epic. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Solid Continuation of the Series. Some of the tropes are starting to wear thin though. I know this is the English translation, slight spoiler: but hopefully the author has the MC not be a virgin at 75 and still saying he wants a harem

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Can #7 hurry up and release?!! I need more!! Binged this series too quick and now I'm on my knees begging for a continuation haha

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars well, this is a good read
reviews.reviewText: Looking forward to see how does this carry the thing is I hope you use it for the office if it’s a story now read it for yourself and have fun everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Funny, silly and a great addition to the series
reviews.reviewText: The current crown prince tries to get at Liam by forcing him and Liam's faction into leading a war, hoping they are tied up for years to come and will loose a significant portion of their forces. To make matters worse, Liam's own citizen start mass protests and fellow pupils of the Flash want to duel him to the death. What follows is as expected a funny highly entertaining story, partially based on misunderstandings (mostly of Liam) and partially due to his conscious actions. A great addition to the series and looking forward to what comes next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book had me on the edge of my seat the plot twists in this book were back to back. I laughed a lot, the battles were epic I’m still wondering when he’s going to bed his fiancé and take woman for his harem hopefully it happens in the next book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was quite good and I want more. A surprising number of things happened in this book which makes me think the next one will be a slow burn. Still looking forward to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Jewel of the Series
reviews.reviewText: The funniest entry yet. I didn’t even know I could laugh that much from a book! Give the series a try, you won’t regret it!
I really enjoyed reading this book and I am really looking forward to reading the next one hopefully very soon too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: In many ways its interesting to see how the guides plans backfire, though it be nice to see other elements perhaps take greater precedent. Either way it's certainly heading in interesting direction and I do love how seemless the authors managed to add the extra bits in. Looking forward to the next volume.
